title: After playback for current track ends, the next one skips to the middle
body:
- [x] I have checked the [FAQ](https://wiki.strawberrymusicplayer.org/wiki/FAQ) for answers.
- [x] I have checked the [Changelog](https://github.com/strawberrymusicplayer/strawberry/blob/master/Changelog) that the issue is not already fixed. 
- [x] I believe this issue is a bug, and not a general technical issue, question or feature requests that can be discussed on the [forum](https://forum.strawberrymusicplayer.org/). 

**Describe the bug**
When playback for a given track ends and the following one starts, the cursor jumps to the middle (more or less)., rather than starting from the beginning of the track.

**To Reproduce**
Play some songs.

**Expected behavior**
Playback does not skip to the middle of the next track, but starts from the beginning.

**Screenshots:**

**System Information:**
 - Operating system: KDE Neon (based on Ubuntu 24.04)
 - Strawberry Version: 1.2.13

**Additional context**
This is what the terminal says:

From this, it looks like I paused and played the track a fair few times in the space of a few milliseconds, which is obviously impossible. The only time I paused the track was at the very end (notice how ~9 seconds have passed in between).
